DataElement.preferredName: Chromogenic in situ Hybridization Diagnostic Procedure Chromosome 17 Signal Result Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: to determine the number or amount of chromosome 17 (one of the three pairs in the fifth group (or group E) of human chromosomes according to the current classification for humans) signals to yield a diagnostic result  through chromogenic in situ hybridization (a technique that combines the sequence-specific detection aspects of FISH with the simple detection methods of immunohistochemistry).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chromogenic in situ Hybridization Diagnostic Procedure Chromosome 17 Signal Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to result of chromosome 17 (one of the three pairs in the fifth group (or group E) of human chromosomes according to the current classification for humans) signals to yield a diagnostic result  through chromogenic in situ hybridization (a technique that combines the sequence-specific detection aspects of FISH with the simple detection methods of immunohistochemistry).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chromogenic in situ Hybridization Diagnostic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Chromogenic in situ hybridization is a technique that combines the sequence-specific detection aspects of FISH with the simple detection methods of immunohistochemistry. Briefly, sequence-specific probes are hybridized to cells fixed on slides and the sequestered probe is visualized by a peroxidase reaction. It has the advantage of being a less costly assay that does not require fluorescence microscopy with results that are stable over time.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that combines the sequence-specific detection aspects of FISH with the simple detection methods of immunohistochemistry. Briefly, sequence-specific probes are hybridized to cells fixed on slides and the sequestered probe is visualized by a peroxidase reaction. It has the advantage of being a less costly assay that does not require fluorescence microscopy with results that are stable over time.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of the three pairs in the fifth group (or group E) of human chromosomes according to the current classification for humans.:A detectable physical quantity or impulse (e.g., voltage, current, or magnetic field strength). (from Merriam Webster OnLine):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The designation for each member of the seventeenth largest human autosomal chromosome pair. Chromosome 17 spans more than 81 million base pairs and represents between 2.5 and 3% of the total DNA in normal diploid cells.
A detectable physical quantity or impulse (e.g., voltage, current, or magnetic field strength).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number or amount of chromosome 17 signalling during a diagnostic procedure (e.g., fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) or CISH).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition in which one chromosome of a pair is missing. In a normally diploid cell it is represented symbolically as 2N-1.

Concepts.definition: A chromosomal abnormality consisting of the absence of one chromosome from the normal diploid number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The condition of having additional copies of a chromosome present in a cell.

Concepts.definition: The condition of having additional copies of a chromosome present in a cell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
